Introduction

Weâ€™re introducing new admin controls for Microsoft Clipchamp and Microsoft Stream to simplify governance and enhance compliance. This update adds five new policy settings that allow administrators to manage video creation and distribution features across both platforms.

This update is associated with Microsoft 365 Roadmap ID 468891.

When this will happen

This feature is available now.

How this affects your organization

Admins will gain expanded control over video-related features in Clipchamp and Stream through five new policy settings in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center. These policies support tenant-level enforcement for compliance, security, and governance goals.

The following capabilities can now be enabled or disabled:

  • AI text-to-speech in Clipchamp
  • Webcam recording in Clipchamp and Stream
  • Screen recording in Clipchamp and Stream
  • Local video downloads in Clipchamp and Stream
  • User-initiated upgrades to Clipchamp Premium

Once configured, these policies will automatically hide or disable related UI elements across supported surfaces, including the Stream recording tool and Clipchamp video editor.

Note: The audio recording policy has been removed from this initial release due to technical blockers. We aim to resolve these issues by the end of CY25 and will provide updates as available.

What you can do to prepare

No action is required to prepare. These capabilities will be rolled out automatically to your tenant. Admins can configure the new policies in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center once available.

Compliance considerations

Compliance AreaExplanation
AI/ML capabilitiesIntroduces admin control over AI text-to-speech in Clipchamp.
Admin control via Entra IDPolicies can be enforced at the tenant level and may be scoped using Entra ID group membership.
Feature enablement by usersAdmins can restrict user-initiated upgrades to Clipchamp Premium.

Title: New admin policy controls for video creation and distribution in Microsoft Clipchamp and Microsoft Stream
